projects.title: WoodYou
projects.description: Creation of a logotype for WoodYou, a specialist in made-to-measure wooden objects, based on the Tangram principle.

section1.title: Step 1:
section1.subtitle: Defining the Message and Image
section1.description: This is the logotype creation process for WoodYou, a company whose main activity is the creation of made-to-measure laser-cut wooden objects for toys, decoration and communication media. This is a two-stage process. The first wave of three proposals allows us to better define with the customer the message and image that the company needs to convey. After selecting a lead and refining the direction to be taken, the second wave of proposals is made. In this project, in the first wave, we were able to discard proposal no. 1 because it was more suggestive of luxury codes, which is not WoodYou's target. We also discarded proposal no. 2 because it only targeted the playful world of toys, where WoodYou wanted to reach beyond that.

section2.title: Step 2:
section2.subtitle: Refine and select the Final Proposal
section2.description: Proposal no. 3 was chosen as the basis for the rest of the project, because it evoked both playfulness, with its reference to the "Tangram" silhouette game, and tailor-made modularity, while at the same time benefiting from the appeal of a mascot animal. The bear was chosen to evoke nature and the forest in a more mature way than other small animals usually associated with childhood, and because it reflects the values of the company's founders: boldness, strength and determination. It was proposal no. 1 of the second wave that was chosen by the client, for its balance of elementary modular forms, retaining the Tangram reference.

projects.title: My FrenChef
projects.description: Chefs' recipes, family nutritional monitoring, video cooking lessons.

section1.title: Enjoyable
section1.subtitle: and Nutritious
section1.description: MyFrenchef meets the need to closely monitor your diet while still enjoying your meals. It offers a wide selection of recipes presented by renowned chefs and allows you to track the nutritional intake of the whole family. By combining video cooking lessons, a recipe planner with a shopping list for ingredient purchases, and a nutrient dashboard, MyFrenchef simplifies daily meal management. Users can discover new recipes, learn sophisticated cooking techniques, and monitor their diet in a fun and enjoyable way.

section2.title: My Role:
section2.subtitle: Artistic Direction, UX, and UI
section2.description: On this project, my work encompasses both artistic direction and UX (user experience) and UI (user interface). As the artistic director, I ensure that MyFrenchef's visual identity is cohesive and appealing, reflecting the quality and expertise of the chefs. For UX, I design intuitive and pleasant user journeys, making it easier to navigate and use the app's various features. Regarding UI, I create clear and aesthetic interfaces, making the user experience not only functional but also visually pleasing. My goal is to ensure a smooth and enjoyable use of MyFrenchef, so users can focus on the joy of cooking and eating well.

projects.title: Stane
projects.description: Stane, creates modern health centers across France by linking public and private entities with healthcare practitioners.

section1.title: Facilitator
section1.subtitle: of Modern Health Centers
section1.description: Stane, formerly known as Osant√©, is a versatile group dedicated to creating health centers throughout France. Their mission is to forge connections between various local entities, whether public, private, or healthcare practitioners, to realize projects for modern and innovative health centers. Acting as a facilitator and catalyst, Stane contributes to improving access to healthcare by promoting infrastructures that meet the contemporary needs of both patients and healthcare professionals.

section2.title: My Role:
section2.subtitle: Artistic Direction, UX, and UI
section2.description: As part of this mission, I had the opportunity to play a crucial role as the head of artistic direction, user experience (UX), and user interface (UI). My involvement was essential to ensure that Stane's projects were not only functional but also aesthetically pleasing and intuitive for users. My work focused on designing a virtuel spaces that is both welcoming and efficient, meeting the expectations of practitioners and patients alike, to create environments conducive to high-quality care.

projects.title: Tiny Office
projects.description: Design and manufacture of stand-alone garden offices

section1.title: Innovating
section1.subtitle: Home Office Solutions
section1.description: TinyOffice is an innovative company specializing in designing and manufacturing autonomous office units to be installed in private gardens. These office units are designed to provide a private, practical, and aesthetic workspace, addressing the growing need for remote work and flexibility. By incorporating modern design solutions and advanced technologies, TinyOffice enables users to enjoy an optimal work environment directly at home while benefiting from the calming surroundings of their garden.

section2.title: My Role:
section2.subtitle: UX and UI
section2.description: In this project, I played a crucial role as the head of user experience (UX), user interface (UI), and the creation of a comprehensive visual identity, excluding the logo. My work involved designing an intuitive and user-friendly interface and developing a cohesive and attractive visual identity for TinyOffice units. The goal was to ensure a smooth and enjoyable user experience while enhancing the company's brand image and attracting quality and aesthetics-conscious clients.

projects.title: Selaliqua
projects.description: Selaliqua's e-commerce homepage redesign focuses on enhancing user engagement and conversion rates through a dialogue-driven approach that streamlines information and aligns with users' online reading behaviors.

section1.title: Through Dialogue:
section1.subtitle: Selaliqua's Homepage Redesign
section1.description: Selaliqua, an e-commerce client, sought to increase the conversion rate of their website traffic through a homepage redesign. The chosen approach was the "dialogue" method, treating the interface as an interlocutor that users engage with by asking questions. This method aimed to enhance the user dialogue by logically and smoothly organizing information. By simulating a natural conversation, the redesign ensures that users can easily find what they need, improving overall navigation and user satisfaction.

section2.title: Reducing Informational Noise
section2.subtitle: and Enhancing User Flow
section2.description: The dialogue approach effectively reduces informational noise that previously cluttered the homepage. This strategy considers the online reading habits of users, who typically scan pages in an "F" pattern, focusing on information placed at the top left, titles, and the initial words of paragraphs. By prioritizing key information in these areas, the redesigned homepage guides users efficiently, making important content more accessible and thereby improving the likelihood of conversions.

projects.title: Odysium
projects.description: Odysium is a company providing a medical concierge service and custom training programs for athletes. The project involved designing a PWA, it's flux and motion, from an existing graphic charter, to seamlessly integrate these two services.

section1.title: UX Process
section1.subtitle: for a Comprehensive PWA
section1.description: Building upon an existing graphic charter, the UX process for designing a Progressive Web App (PWA) for Odysium involved a meticulous and structured approach. The objective was to seamlessly combine the two primary services offered to Odysium's clients. The first service is a medical concierge tailored for athletes and their managers, providing them with personalized and accessible healthcare support. Understanding the unique needs and workflows of these users was crucial. Through user research, including interviews and surveys, we gathered insights into their daily routines, pain points, and preferences, which informed our design decisions.

section2.title: Integrating Training Programs
section2.subtitle: for Enhanced User Experience
section2.description: The second service focuses on customized training programs created by Odysium's coaches for the athletes they monitor. To integrate this into the PWA, we conducted a detailed analysis of how athletes interact with their training regimens. We employed user personas and journey mapping to visualize their experience and identify opportunities for improvement. Prototyping and user testing were essential to ensure that the interface was intuitive and engaging, allowing athletes to easily access and follow their training plans. By combining these two services into a cohesive PWA, we aimed to deliver a holistic and user-centered experience that enhances both the medical and training support for Odysium's clients.

projects.title: Nuclear medicine centers
projects.description: The project involved creating the graphic identity and designing a user-friendly website for the nuclear medicine centers in √éle-de-France, focusing on appointment scheduling, detailed procedure explanations, and clear presentation of institutional information for a predominantly elderly audience.

section1.title: Developing
section1.subtitle: the Graphic Identity
section1.description: The project began with creating the graphic identity for the nuclear medicine centers in √éle-de-France. This involved designing a cohesive visual identity that would be instantly recognizable and convey professionalism and trust. The design elements, such as the logo, color palette, typography, and imagery, were chosen to reflect the seriousness and precision of the medical field. The aim was to ensure that patients and their families, as well as medical professionals, could easily identify and feel confident in the centers' branding.

section2.title: Designing the Website
section2.subtitle: for Accessibility and Clarity
section2.description: Following the graphic identity creation, the next step was to design a user-friendly website that addressed several key needs. The site was developed to facilitate appointment scheduling, providing detailed explanations of examination procedures, and presenting institutional information in a clear and organized manner. Given that the primary audience is predominantly elderly, the website's design focused on simplicity and readability, with intuitive navigation, larger text, and clear calls to action to ensure that users could easily access the information and services they needed.
